metadata.title: CVE-2023-36747 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: Multiple heap-based buffer overflow vulnerabilities exist in thefstReaderIterBlocks2 fstWritex len functionality of GTKWave 3.3.115. Aspecially crafted .fst file can lead to memory corruption. A victim wouldneed to open a malicious file to trigger these vulnerabilities.Thisvulnerability concerns the handling of `len` in `fstWritex` when `beg_time`does not match the start of the time table.

criterions.comment: gtkwave: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
